content.text:
# List of heads of state of the Democratic People's Republic of Angola

(Bold italics in name indicates popular nickname)
{| class="wikitable"
|- align=left
! width="18%"|Tenure
! width="45%"|Incumbent
! width="7%"|Affiliation
! width="20%"|Notes
|- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec"
|rowspan="2"|11 November 1975 to 11 February 1976||Holden Álvaro Roberto, President of the Joint National Council for the Revolution||valign=top|FNLA|| 
|- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec"
|Jonas Malheiro Savimbi, President of the Joint National Council for the Revolution||valign=top|UNITA|| 
|- valign=top
|11 February 1976||colspan="3"|Counter-government suppressed by Angolan government
|-
|1979||colspan="3"|Counter-government restored
|- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec"
|1979 to 22 February 2002||Jonas Malheiro Savimbi, President||valign=top|UNITA|| 
|- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec"
|22 February 2002 to 4 April 2002||'Paulo Lukamba Gato', interim leader, Secretary-General of UNITA||UNITA|| 
|-
|4 April 2002||Accord ends Civil War
|}
Affiliations
{| style="margin:0 auto;" class="toccolours" cellpadding=1
|-
! width="7%"|
! width="40%"|
|- valign=top
|rowspan="2"|FNLA||Frente Nacional de Libertação de Angola
|-
|(National Front for the Liberation of Angola) northern regionalist, estd.1957 as UPNA: (Unio das Populacoes do Norte de Angola)
|-
|rowspan="2"|UNITA||União Nacional para a Independência Total de Angola
|-
|(National Union for the Total Independence of Angola) authoritarian/conservative, primarily ethnic Ovimbundu
|-
|}
Sources
*
* African States and Rulers, John Stewart, McFarland
* Heads of State and Government, 2nd Edition, John V da Graca, MacMillan Press 2000
